title: What popular songs have lyrics that mention a U.S. state? - Quora

response.answer_text: Alabama, Sweet Home Alabama- Lynard Skynyrd Alaska, North To Alaska- Johnny Horto Arizona, Take it Easy- Eagles Arkansas, Mary Queen Of Arkansas- Bruce Springsteen California, California Love- 2Pac Colorado, Mountain High- John Denver Connecticut, Peace Connecticut- Apathy Delaware, Delaware Slide- George Thorogood & The Destroyers Florida, Miami- Will Smith Georgia, The Devil Went Down To Georgia- Charlie Daniels Band Hawaii, Beach In Hawaii- Ziggy Marley Idaho, Private Idaho- The B52s Illinois, Illinois- Brett Eldredge Indiana, Small Town - John Mellencamp Iowa, Iowa( travelling part 3)- Dar Williams Kansas, Witchta Lineman- Glen Campbell Kentucky, Blue Moon Of Kentucky- Elvis Presley Louiseanna, House Of The Rising Sun- The Animals Maine, Portland, Maine- Donovan Woods Maryland, Baltimore- Nina Simone Massachusetts, I'm Shipping Up To Boston- The Dropkick Murphys Michigan, Detroit Rock City- Kiss Minnesota, Say Shh- Atmosphere Mississippi, Mississippi Girl- Faith Hill Missouri, Kansas City- Wilbert Harrison Montana, Meet Me In Montana- Dan Seals and Marie Osmond Nebraska, Omaha- Counting Crows Nevada, Waking Up In Vegas- Katy Perry New Hampshire, New Hampshire- Matt Pond PA New Jersey, Jersey Girl- Bruce Springsteen New Mexico, Albuquerque- Neil Young New York, New York New York- Frank Sinatra North Carolina, Carolina On My Mind- James Taylor North Dakota, North Dakota- Lyle Lovett Ohio, Ohio- Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young Oklahoma, Oklahoma Sky- Miranda Lambert Oregon, Portland, Oregon- Loretta Lynn Pennsylvania, Streets Of Philadelphia- Bruce Springsteen Rhode Island, Rhode Island Is Famous For You- Blossom Dearie South Carolina, Hickory Wind- The Byrds South Dakota, Badlands- Bruce Springsteen Tennessee, Tennessee Love- Yelawolf Texas, Luckenbach ,Texas- Waylon Jennings Utah, Salt Lake City- The Beach Boys Vermont, Moonlight in Vermont- Frank Sinatra Virginia, Virginia Moon- Foo Fighters Washington, Hello Seattle-Owl City West Virginia, Take Me Home, Country Roads- John Denver Wisconsin, Lake Maria- John Prine Wyoming, Paint Me Back Home In Wyoming

God Bless the USA-Lee Greenwood (From the lakes of Minnesota to the hills of Tennessee across the plains of Texas from sea to shining sea). Love can move you-Savage Garden (I gotta see the lights up in New York City… Creepin’ Like a snake into New York City). California-Darren Hayes Welcome to New York-Taylor Swift Tim McGraw-Taylor Swift (You said the way my blue eyes shined put those Georgia stars to shame that night). Hoax-Taylor Swift (I left a part of me back in New York). Jersey strong-After The Reign California gurls-Katy Perry Party-Girls Generation (California, wherever we go). I hate California-Uncle Kracker My girlfriend-Uncle Kracker (That sweet southern belle that I met in Tennessee got a hickey on her neck and it ain’t from me). Back to Tennessee-Billy Ray Cyrus Tenntucky-Billy Ray Cyrus Carolina-Parmalee (She feels like Carolina, looks like California, shiny like those New York lights on Broadway). Young in America-Danielle Bradbery (Maybe Tennessee, LA, NYC, Mississippi). Wake up-Hilary Duff (Could be New York maybe Hollywood and Vine). Sunshine and whiskey-Frankie Ballard (Chillin’ on the beach with my sweet Georgia peach). All summer long-Kid Rock (It was summertime in northern Michigan… singing sweet home Alabama all summer long). Sweet home Alabama-Lynyrd Skynyrd Jersey Girl-Bruce Springsteen Chicken fried-Zac Brown Band (I was raised underneath the shade of a Georgia pine). Highway 20 ride-Zac Brown Band (Every time I turn that truck around right at the Georgia line). Cruise-Florida Georgia Line (She’s poppin’ right out of the South Georgia water). Get your shine on-Florida Georgia Line (Feelin’ lucky got hooked up with some Kentucky clear). Georgia rain-Trisha Yearwood
